DataElement.preferredName: Patient Brain Lesion Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to an area of abnormal tissue change in the brain as an element of the personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Brain Lesion Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to an area of abnormal tissue change in the brain as an element of the personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Brain Lesion Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Any unresected lesions must m
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any unresected lesions must measure <=3.0 cm in maximal extent on the contrasted preoperative treatment MRI brain scan obtained <=35 days prior to pre-registration (see Magnetic Resonance Imaging Guidelines, Section 11.2).  The unresected lesions will be treated with SRS as outlined in the treatment section (Section 7.0) of the protocol.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any unresected lesions must measure <=3.0 cm in maximal extent on the contrasted MRI brain scan obtained <=35 days prior to pre-registration (see Magnetic Resonance Imaging Guidelines, Section 11.2). The unresected lesions will be treated with SRS as outlined in the treatment section (Section 7.0) of the protocol.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an intrinsic brain stem tumors, optic pathway gliomas, or pineal tumors and elevations of CSF or serum tumor markers including alpha-fetoprotein or beta-HCG

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any unresected lesions must measure <3.0 cm in maximal extent on the contrasted MRI or CT brain scan obtained <=35 days prior to pre-registration (see Magnetic Resonance Imaging Guidelines, Section 11.2). The unresected lesions will be treated with SRS as outlined in the treatment section (Section 7.4) of the protocol.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have biopsy confirmed anaplastic astrocytoma, glioblastoma, gliosarcoma, or anaplastic mixed glioma

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have recurrent, progressive or refractory diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma (DIPG)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have intrinsic brain stem tumors, optic pathway gliomas, indicated germ-cell tumors or elevations of serum tumor markers including alpha-fetoprotein or beta-HCG

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have intrinsic brain stem tumors, optic pathway gliomas, CNS germ cell tumors or extra-cranial germ cell tumors with elevations of CSF or serum tumor markers including alpha-fetoprotein or beta-HCG

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have diffuse intrinsic pontine tumors as seen on MRI (greater than 2/3 of pons involvement on imaging)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do the distant brain relapse lesions to be treated measure less than or equal to 3.0 cm in maximal extent and the total volume measures less than 30 mL on the contrast-enhanced diagnostic MRI within 21 days prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the lesion to be resected on the post-contrast MRI, as measured on any orthogonal plane (axial, sagittal, coronal), maximum diameter measure greater than or equal to 2.0 cm and less than or equal to 5.0 cm?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT3
ReferenceDocuments.description: At least 1 of the up to 8 lesions must be a study eligible lesion, defined as lesion with a maximum diameter as measured on any orthogonal plane (axial, sagittal, coronal)of greater than or equal to 1.0 cm and less than or equal to 3.0 cm

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
